About Me

Polymath

BIO

I took the long way 'round in becoming a software developer, but have always been a student. Whether in or out of a classroom, and even in my downtime, you can usually find me investigating some scientific theory, academic study, animal, or other topic that peaks my interest. This has been reflected in both my work history and performance. I often find that looking at a problem from another perspective, even one outside the discipline of the current task, offers unique avenues and possible solutions. (And yes, I am that guy who spits out random facts mid-conversation because you said a word that jogged something in my memory.)

Ketch/Intenxus LLC

Javascript Developer/Consultant

Full Stack Javascript role responsible for both front and back end work, as well as small prototypes, demo applications, and SAP/open-sourced integration strategies.

Viking Code School

Software Engineering Apprentice

Accelerated Training program. Built well-tested production applications using Agile methods and modern tech stacks (JavaScript, Node, SQL, MongoDB, ReactJS among others).

... and Everything Else

Jack of All Trades

I firmly believe there is the right job for everyone and spent years looking for mine before become a developer. I've done everything from construction to management and computer repair. It's a long story, but if you're interested, I'd love to tell you sometime.
